00068 // stop record or play - to be called with interrupts disabled
00069 static void isrStop(void) {
00070   ADCSRA &= ~(1 << ADIE);  // disable ADC interrupt
00071   TIMSK1 &= ~_BV(OCIE1B);  // disable DAC timer interrupt
00072   WaveRP::rpState = RP_STATE_STOPPED;
00073 }
00074 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00075 // timer interrupt for DAC
00076 ISR(TIMER1_COMPB_vect) {
00077   if (WaveRP::rpState != RP_STATE_PLAYING) {
00078     TIMSK1 &= ~_BV(OCIE1B);  // disable DAC timer interrupt
00079     return;
00080   }
00081   // pause has not been tested
00082   if (WaveRP::rpPause) return;
00083   if (rpIndex >= rpByteCount) {
00084     if (WaveRP::sdStatus == SD_STATUS_BUFFER_READY) {
00085       // swap buffers
00086       uint8_t *tmp = rpBuffer;
00087       rpBuffer = sdBuffer;
00088       sdBuffer = tmp;
00089       rpIndex = 0;
00090       rpByteCount = sdByteCount;
00091       WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_BUFFER_BUSY;
00092       // cause interrupt to start SD read
00093       TIMSK1 |= _BV(OCIE1A);
00094     } else if (WaveRP::sdStatus == SD_STATUS_BUFFER_BUSY) {
00095       if (WaveRP::busyError != 0XFF) WaveRP::busyError++;
00096       return;
00097     } else {
00098       isrStop();
00099       return;
00100     }
00101   }
00102   uint16_t data;
00103   if (WaveRP::bitsPerSample == 8) {
00104     // 8-bit is unsigned
00105     data = rpBuffer[rpIndex] << 4;
00106     rpIndex++;
00107   } else {
00108     // 16-bit is signed - keep high 12 bits for DAC
00109     data = ((rpBuffer[rpIndex + 1] ^ 0X80) << 4) | (rpBuffer[rpIndex] >> 4);
00110     rpIndex += 2;
00111   }
00112 #if DVOLUME
00113   if (WaveRP::volMult) {
00114     uint32_t tmp = WaveRP::volMult * (uint32_t)data;
00115     data = tmp >> 8;
00116     data += WaveRP::volOffset;
00117   }
00118 #endif  // DVOLUME
00119   mcpDacSend(data);
00120 }
00121 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00122 // ADC done interrupt
00123 ISR(ADC_vect) {
00124   // read data
00125   uint8_t sample = ADCH;
00126   // clear timer campare B flag
00127   TIFR1 &= _BV(OCF1B);
00128   if (WaveRP::rpState != RP_STATE_RECORDING) {
00129     // disable ADC interrupt
00130     ADCSRA &= ~(1 << ADIE);
00131     return;
00132   }
00133   // set min and max before pause
00134   if (sample > WaveRP::adcMax) WaveRP::adcMax = sample;
00135   if (sample < WaveRP::adcMin) WaveRP::adcMin = sample;
00136   // pause has not been tested
00137   if (WaveRP::rpPause) return;
00138   if (rpIndex >= BUF_LENGTH) {
00139     if (WaveRP::sdStatus == SD_STATUS_BUFFER_READY) {
00140      // swap buffers
00141       uint8_t *tmp = sdBuffer;
00142       sdBuffer = rpBuffer;
00143       rpBuffer = tmp;
00144       WaveRP::sdStatus= SD_STATUS_BUFFER_BUSY;
00145       rpIndex = 0;
00146       // cause interrupt to start SD write
00147       TIMSK1 |= _BV(OCIE1A);
00148     } else if (WaveRP::sdStatus == SD_STATUS_BUFFER_BUSY) {
00149       if (WaveRP::busyError != 0XFF) WaveRP::busyError++;
00150       return;
00151     } else {
00152       isrStop();
00153       return;
00154     }
00155   }
00156   rpBuffer[rpIndex++] = sample;
00157 }
00158 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00159 // Interrupt for SD read/write
00160 ISR(TIMER1_COMPA_vect) {
00161   // disable interrupt
00162   TIMSK1 &= ~_BV(OCIE1A);
00163   if (WaveRP::sdStatus != SD_STATUS_BUFFER_BUSY) return;
00164   sei();
00165 //  Sd2Card *card = SdVolume::sdCard();
00166   if (WaveRP::rpState == RP_STATE_RECORDING) {
00167     // write 512 byte data block to SD
00168     if (!WaveRP::sdCard->writeData(sdBuffer)) {
00169       WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_IO_ERROR;
00170       return;
00171     }
00172     WaveRP::sdCurPosition += 512;
00173     // check for end of preallocated file
00174     if (WaveRP::sdCurPosition >= WaveRP::sdEndPosition) {
00175       WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_END_OF_DATA;
00176       // terminate SD multiple block write
00177       WaveRP::sdCard->writeStop();
00178       return;
00179     }
00180   } else if (WaveRP::rpState == RP_STATE_PLAYING) {
00181     sdByteCount = BUF_LENGTH;
00182     uint32_t dataRemaining = WaveRP::sdEndPosition - WaveRP::sdCurPosition;
00183     if (sdByteCount > dataRemaining) {
00184       sdByteCount = dataRemaining;
00185       if (sdByteCount == 0) {
00186         WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_END_OF_DATA;
00187         return;
00188       }
00189     }
00190     uint32_t block = WaveRP::sdStartBlock + WaveRP::sdCurPosition/512;
00191     WaveRP::sdCurPosition += sdByteCount;
00192     if (!WaveRP::sdCard->readBlock(block, sdBuffer)) {
00193       WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_IO_ERROR;
00194       return;
00195     }
00196   }
00197   cli();
00198   WaveRP::sdStatus = SD_STATUS_BUFFER_READY;
00199 }

00203 // start ADC - should test results of prescaler algorithm.  Does it help?
00204 // The idea is to allow max time for ADC to minimize noise.
00205 static void adcInit(uint16_t rate, uint8_t pin, uint8_t ref) {
00206   // Set ADC reference
00207   // Left adjust ADC result to allow easy 8 bit reading
00208   // Set low three bits of analog pin number
00209   //  ADMUX = (1 << REFS0) | (1 << ADLAR) | (ADC_PIN & 7);
00210   ADMUX = (1 << ADLAR);
00211   ADMUX = (ref & ADC_REF_MASK) |(1 << ADLAR) | (pin & 7);
00212   // trigger on timer/counter 1 compare match B
00213   ADCSRB = (1 << ADTS2) | (1 << ADTS0);
00214 #if defined(__AVR_ATmega1280__) || defined(__AVR_ATmega2560__)
00215   // the MUX5 bit of ADCSRB selects whether we're reading from channels
00216   // 0 to 7 (MUX5 low) or 8 to 15 (MUX5 high).
00217   if (pin > 7) ADCSRB |= (1 << MUX5);
00218 #endif  // defined(__AVR_ATmega1280__) || defined(__AVR_ATmega2560__)
00219   // Each sample requires 13 ADC clock cycles
00220   // prescaler must be smaller than preMax
00221   uint16_t preMax = F_CPU/(rate * 13UL);
00222   uint8_t adps;  // prescaler bits for ADCSRA
00223   if (preMax > 100) {
00224     // use prescaler of 64
00225     adps = (1 << ADPS2) | (1 << ADPS1);
00226   } else if (preMax > 50) {
00227     // use prescaler of 32
00228     adps = (1 << ADPS2) | (1 << ADPS0);
00229   } else if (preMax > 25) {
00230     // use prescaler of 16
00231     adps = (1 << ADPS2);
00232   } else {
00233     // use prescaler of 8
00234     adps = (1 << ADPS1) | (1 << ADPS0);
00235   }
00236   // Enable ADC, Auto trigger mode, Enable ADC Interrupt, Start A2D Conversions
00237   ADCSRA = (1 << ADEN) | (1 << ADATE) | (1 << ADIE) | (1 << ADSC) | adps;
00238 }
00239 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00240 // setup 16 bit timer1
00241 static void setRate(uint16_t rate) {
00242   // no pwm
00243   TCCR1A = 0;
00244   // no clock div, CTC mode
00245   TCCR1B = _BV(WGM13) | _BV(WGM12) | _BV(CS10);
00246   // set TOP for timer reset
00247   ICR1 = F_CPU/(uint32_t)rate;
00248   // compare for SD interrupt
00249   OCR1A =  10;
00250   // compare for DAC interrupt
00251   OCR1B = 1;
00252 }
00253 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00254 // do a binary search to find recorded part of a wave file
00255 // assumes file was pre-erased using SD erase command
00256 static uint8_t waveSize(SdBaseFile* file, uint32_t* size) {
00257   Sd2Card* card = file->volume()->sdCard();
00258   uint32_t hi;
00259   uint32_t lo;
00260   uint16_t n;
00261   // get block range for file
00262   if (!file->contiguousRange(&lo, &hi)) return false;
00263   // remember first
00264   uint32_t first = lo;
00265   // find last block of recorded data
00266   while (lo < hi) {
00267     // need to add one to round up mid - matches way interval is divided below
00268     uint32_t mid = (hi + lo + 1)/2;
00269     // read block
00270     if (!WaveRP::sdCard->readBlock(mid, buf)) {
00271       return false;
00272     }
00273     // look for data - SD erase may result in all zeros or all ones
00274     for (n = 0; n < 512; n++) {
00275       if (0 < buf[n] && buf[n] < 0XFF) break;
00276     }
00277     if (n == 512) {
00278       // no data search lower half of interval
00279       hi = mid - 1;
00280     } else {
00281       // search upper half of interval keeping found data in interval
00282       lo = mid;
00283     }
00284   }
00285   // read last block with data to get count for last block
00286   if (!card->readBlock(lo, buf)) return false;
00287   for (n = 512; n > 0; n--) {
00288     if (0 < buf[n-1] && buf[n-1] < 0XFF) break;
00289   }
00290   *size = 512*(lo - first) + n;
00291   return true;
00292 }

00302 bool WaveRP::play(SdBaseFile* file) {
00303   sdCard = file->volume()->sdCard();
00304   if (!file->contiguousRange(&sdStartBlock, &sdEndBlock)) {
00305     PgmPrintln("File is not contiguous");
00306     return false;
00307   }
00308   // read header into buffer
00309   WaveHeaderExtra *header = reinterpret_cast<WaveHeaderExtra *>(buf);
00310   // compiler will optimize these out - makes program more readable
00311   WaveRiff *riff = &header->riff;
00312   WaveFmtExtra *fmt = &header->fmt;
00313   WaveData *data = &header->data;
00314   file->rewind();
00315 
00316   // file must start with RIFF chunck
00317   if (file->read(riff, 12) != 12
00318       || strncmp_P(riff->id, PSTR("RIFF"), 4)
00319       || strncmp_P(riff->type, PSTR("WAVE"), 4)) {
00320         return false;
00321   }
00322   // fmt chunck must be next
00323   if (file->read(fmt, 8) != 8
00324      || strncmp_P(fmt->id, PSTR("fmt "), 4)) {
00325         return false;
00326   }
00327   uint16_t size = fmt->size;
00328   if (size == 16 || size == 18) {
00329     if (file->read(&fmt->formatTag, size) != (int16_t)size) {
00330       return false;
00331     }
00332   } else {
00333     // don't read fmt chunk - must not be compressed so cause an error
00334     fmt->formatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_UNKNOWN;
00335   }
00336   if (fmt->formatTag != WAVE_FORMAT_PCM) {
00337     PgmPrintln("Compression not supported");
00338     return false;
00339   }
00340   Channels = fmt->channels;
00341   if (Channels > 2) {
00342     PgmPrintln("Not mono/stereo!");
00343     return false;
00344   }
00345   sampleRate = fmt->sampleRate;
00346   bitsPerSample = fmt->bitsPerSample;
00347   if (bitsPerSample > 16) {
00348     PgmPrintln("More than 16 bits per sample!");
00349     return false;
00350   }
00351   uint8_t tooFast = sampleRate > 44100;  // flag
00352   if (sampleRate > 22050) {
00353     // ie 44khz
00354     if (Channels > 1) tooFast = 1;
00355   }
00356   if (tooFast) {
00357     PgmPrintln("Sample rate too high!");
00358     return false;
00359   }
00360   // find the data chunck
00361   while (1) {
00362     // read chunk ID
00363     if (file->read(data, 8) != 8) return false;
00364     if (!strncmp_P(data->id, PSTR("data"), 4)) {
00365       sdEndPosition = file->curPosition() + data->size;
00366       break;
00367     }
00368     // if not "data" then skip it!
00369     if (!file->seekCur(data->size)) return false;
00370   }
00371   sdCurPosition = file->curPosition();
00372 
00373   rpBuffer = buf;
00374   // fill the buffers so SD blocks line up with buffer boundaries.
00375   rpByteCount = BUF_LENGTH - file->curPosition() % BUF_LENGTH;
00376   uint32_t maxCount = sdEndPosition - sdCurPosition;
00377   if (rpByteCount > maxCount) rpByteCount = maxCount;
00378   if (file->read(rpBuffer, rpByteCount) != rpByteCount) return false;
00379   sdCurPosition += rpByteCount;
00380   sdBuffer = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(file->volume()->cacheClear());
00381   if (sdCurPosition < sdEndPosition) {
00382     sdByteCount = BUF_LENGTH;
00383     maxCount = sdEndPosition - sdCurPosition;
00384     if (maxCount < sdByteCount) sdByteCount = maxCount;
00385     uint32_t block = sdStartBlock + sdCurPosition / 512;
00386     if (!sdCard->readBlock(block, sdBuffer)) return false;
00387     sdStatus = SD_STATUS_BUFFER_READY;
00388     sdCurPosition += sdByteCount;
00389   } else {
00390     sdByteCount = 0;
00391     sdStatus = SD_STATUS_END_OF_DATA;
00392   }
00393   busyError = 0;
00394   sdFile = file;
00395   // clear pasue
00396   rpPause = false;
00397   // set ADC/DAC state
00398   rpState = RP_STATE_PLAYING;
00399   // setup timer
00400   setRate(sampleRate*Channels);
00401   // initialize DAC pins
00402   mcpDacInit();
00403   // enable timer interrupt for DAC
00404   TIMSK1 |= _BV(OCIE1B);
00405   return true;
00406 }

00417 bool WaveRP::record(SdBaseFile* file, uint16_t rate, uint8_t pin, uint8_t ref) {
00418   sdCard = file->volume()->sdCard();
00419   if (rate < 4000 || 44100 < rate) {
00420     PgmPrintln("rate not in range 4000 to 44100");
00421     return false;
00422   }
00423   if (pin > ADC_MAX_PIN || ref != (ref & ADC_REF_MASK)) return false;
00424   sdFile = file;
00425 //  Sd2Card *card = SdVolume::sdCard();
00426   // get raw location of file's data blocks
00427   if (!file->contiguousRange(&sdStartBlock, &sdEndBlock)) return false;
00428   // tell SD card to erase all of the file's data
00429   if (!sdCard->erase(sdStartBlock, sdEndBlock)) return false;
00430   // setup timer
00431   setRate(rate);
00432   sdBuffer = buf;
00433   sdStatus = SD_STATUS_BUFFER_READY;
00434   // use SdVolume's cache as second buffer to save RAM
00435   // can't access files while recording
00436   if (!(rpBuffer = reinterpret_cast<uint8_t*>(file->volume()->cacheClear()))) {
00437     return false;
00438   }
00439   // fill in wave file header
00440   WaveHeader *header = reinterpret_cast<WaveHeader *>(rpBuffer);
00441   // RIFF chunck
00442   strncpy_P(header->riff.id, PSTR("RIFF"), 4);
00443   header->riff.size = file->fileSize() - 8;
00444   strncpy_P(header->riff.type, PSTR("WAVE"), 4);
00445   // fmt chunck
00446   strncpy_P(header->fmt.id, PSTR("fmt "), 4);
00447   header->fmt.size = sizeof(WaveFmt) - 8;
00448   header->fmt.formatTag = WAVE_FORMAT_PCM;
00449   header->fmt.channels = 1;
00450   header->fmt.sampleRate = rate;
00451   header->fmt.bytesPerSecond = rate;
00452   header->fmt.blockAlign = 1;
00453   header->fmt.bitsPerSample = 8;
00454   // data chunck
00455   strncpy_P(header->data.id, PSTR("data"), 4);
00456   header->data.size = file->fileSize() - sizeof(WaveHeader);
00457   // location for first sample
00458   rpIndex = sizeof(WaveHeader);
00459   // zero rest of block
00460   for (uint16_t i = rpIndex; i < BUF_LENGTH; i++) rpBuffer[i] = 0;
00461   // write first block to SD in case no data is recorded
00462   if (!sdCard->writeBlock(sdStartBlock, rpBuffer)) return false;
00463   // begin position for ISR write handler
00464   sdCurPosition = rpIndex;
00465   // end position for ISR write handler
00466   sdEndPosition = file->fileSize();
00467 
00468   busyError = 0;
00469   // tell the SD card where we plan to write
00470   if (!sdCard->writeStart(sdStartBlock, sdEndBlock - sdStartBlock + 1)) {
00471     return false;
00472   }
00473   // clear pasue
00474   rpPause = false;
00475   // set ADC/DAC state
00476   rpState = RP_STATE_RECORDING;
00477   // start the ADC
00478   adcInit(rate, pin, ref);
00479   return true;
00480 }

00496 void WaveRP::stop(void) {
00497   cli();
00498   uint8_t tmp = rpState;
00499   isrStop();
00500   sei();
00501   // clear pasue
00502   rpPause = false;
00503   if (tmp == RP_STATE_RECORDING) {
00504     sdCard->writeStop();
00505   }
00506 }

00514 bool WaveRP::trim(SdBaseFile* file) {
00515   uint32_t fsize;
00516   // if error getting size of recording
00517   if (!waveSize(file, &fsize)) return false;
00518   // if too short to have header
00519   if (fsize < sizeof(WaveHeader)) return false;
00520   if (!file->seekSet(0)) return false;
00521   // read header
00522   if (file->read(buf, sizeof(WaveHeader)) != sizeof(WaveHeader)) return false;
00523   WaveHeader *header = reinterpret_cast<WaveHeader *>(buf);
00524   // check for correct size header
00525   if (strncmp_P(header->data.id, PSTR("data"), 4)) return false;
00526   // update size fields
00527   header->riff.size = fsize - 8;
00528   header->data.size = fsize - sizeof(WaveHeader);
00529   if (!file->seekSet(0)) return false;
00530   // write header back
00531   if (file->write(buf, sizeof(WaveHeader)) != sizeof(WaveHeader)) return false;
00532   // truncate file
00533   return file->truncate(fsize);
00534 }

00543 void WaveRP::seek(uint32_t pos) {
00544   pos -= pos % BUF_LENGTH;
00545   // don't play metadata
00546   if (pos < BUF_LENGTH) pos = BUF_LENGTH;
00547   if (pos > sdEndPosition) pos = sdEndPosition;
00548   if (isPlaying() && isPaused()) sdCurPosition = pos;
00549 }

00556 void WaveRP::setSampleRate(uint32_t samplerate) {
00557   if (isPlaying()) {
00558     while (TCNT1 != 0);
00559     ICR1 = F_CPU / samplerate;
